name: places/ChIJLX_dco9ZwokRNBwuaNmYEyA
formattedAddress: 244 Elizabeth St, New York, NY 10012, USA
adrFormatAddress: 244 Elizabeth St, New York, NY 10012, USA

originalText.text:
This boutique, among the few offering niche perfumes in New York City, truly impressed me.
The saleswoman, remarkably knowledgeable and passionate, guided me through an enchanting selection.
I even purchased perfumes unavailable in France, despite the higher prices here.
I'm already planning to return."

text.text:

The saleswoman, remarkably knowledgeable and passionate, guided me through an enchanting selection.
I even purchased perfumes unavailable in France, despite the higher prices here.
I'm already planning to return."

originalText.text: I am a huge fragrance addict and I am glad I came across this place because it’s very hard to find niche luxury fragrances in person throughout the city. So I’m glad my favorites are all under one roof! Rose is super helpful and patient with customers and she has no problem with you smelling whatever you want and taking your time. She is very knowledgeable on what fragrances and brands would work with what specifically you’re looking for. I plan to visit back from time to time to make sure I don’t make a blind buy and hope this place never closes down!

originalText.text: Margarita was knowledgeable, kind and curious. Her enthusiasm and expertise led me out of my normal range to a few fragrances that I loved and wound up purchasing. Even though the store was quite busy, she made me feel welcome and well cared for. Can’t wait to return!

text.text: Margarita was knowledgeable, kind and curious. Her enthusiasm and expertise led me out of my normal range to a few fragrances that I loved and wound up purchasing. Even though the store was quite busy, she made me feel welcome and well cared for. Can’t wait to return!

originalText.text: Nice Boutique the location is a little small it only allows 8ppl at a time. The service was not upto par. Im going to assumed and give them the benefit of doubt that it was because it was so busy. We just felt rushed.  When she brought a few bottles(6)for us to smell she rushed the bottles to the counter drop drop  and go to another customer. There was no "one on one" interaction.

originalText.text:
I was visiting NYC this past week, and was very very excited to visit Scent bar as it had all my favorite fragrances and I was so happy I was able to try them all. Scent bar was at the top of my things to do!

My first visit was amazing and I could not have had a better experience. Every staff member was helpful, friendly and attentive and I really enjoyed my time there. That is why I wanted to visit again, before I left NYC!

However, after my second visit, my excitement turned into disappointment after the visit to the Scent bar. One of the staff members, who were tall, blonde hair past the shoulders, whom I do not want to assume the gender of, was giving me and my friends nothing but attitude, and acted in a way that no one in the customer service industry should. This totally ruined my experience at Scent Bar, even after the first great visit and I am very disappointed. As a top-notch store, I do feel like this type of staff conduct is not acceptable. Both of the visits, there were similar number of guests in store, so the business of the store should not be an excuse for this type of behavior.

However, besides this experience, I am giving three stars because the collection of fragrances and all the other staff members that assisted me were amazing! :) I just hope that management can train that one staff better.
